page.title: 20Rawmarsh dialect - examples
page.content:
Some examples of Rawmarsh dialect are given below.
{mend the fire}= put on more fuel {snap}= packed lunch taken to work {mither}= bother, eg."don't mither me" {while}= until, eg. "wait while later" {wagging}= playing truant {spragging}= telling tales {right}= very, eg. "right exciting" {rare}= very good, eg. "a rare fight" {early doors}= early {middling}= average {crack}= to hit {ay up}= hello, an all-purpose greeting {thee,tha}= you (not interchangeable, eg. "tha knows" or "tha does right" but "who asked thee?")
The material for the text section of the Project has been researched by Form 1/8, Rawmarsh Comprehensive 1985.
